lead_paragraph: A ruling by the National Labor Relations Board involving students at Columbia opens the door for teaching assistants at private universities to organize.

headline.print_headline: Grad Students Are Given Right to Form Unions
headline.main: Grad Students Win Right to Unionize in an Ivy League Case

snippet: A ruling by the National Labor Relations Board involving students at Columbia opens the door for teaching assistants at private universities to organize....
abstract: National Labor Relations Board rules students who work as teaching and research assistants at private universities have federally backed right to unionize; case arose from petition filed by group of Columbia University graduate students and reflects growing perception among white-collar and academic workers that they, like blue collar workers who began union movement, are at mercies of faceless, corporate entities and are not being treated like professionals worthy of respect.
